text: Suhaila Siddiq (March 11, 1949https://www.haqiqat.org/%D8%A7%D8%AC%D8%AA%D9%85%D8%A7%D8%B9%DB%8C-%D8%A7%D9%82%D8%AA%D8%B5%D8%A7%D8%AF%DB%8C/%DA%AF%D8%B2%D8%A7%D8%B1%D8%B4-%D8%A7%D8%B2-%D8%AF%D9%88%DA%A9%D8%AA%D9%88%D8%B1-%D9%86%D8%AB%D8%A7%D8%B1-%D8%A7%D8%AD%D9%85%D8%AF-%D8%B5%D8%AF%DB%8C%D9%82%DB%8C-%D8%B2%D9%86%D8%AF%DA%AF%DB%8C%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%85%D9%87-%D9%BE%D9%88%D9%87%D8%A7%D9%86%D8%AF-%D8%AF%D8%A7%DA%A9%D8%AA%D8%B1-%D8%B3%D9%87%DB%8C%D9%84%D8%A7-%D8%B5%D8%AF%DB%8C%D9%82/ â€“ December 4, 2020) was an Afghan politician. She was born in Kabul, Afghanistan. Seddiqi was Minister of Public Health from 2001 to 2004 during the Hamid Karzai presidency. Seddiqi died on December 4, 2020 in Kabul from Alzheimer's disease-related problems at the age of 71. ==References== ==Other websites== *'We Can Only Rely On Ourselves To Rebuild Our Country' Category:1949 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Afghan writers Category:Afghan politicians Category:Deaths from Alzheimer's disease Category:21st-century Afghan people Category:20th-century Afghan people
title: Suhaila Seddiqi
